li.a: NEW Out of Zone/ Out of District Process

div.p: Through commitment and collaboration, Bartow County middle school principals secure a tentative plan to provide its families with virtual Awards Day ceremonies that focus on academics, athletics, clubs, and other special awards normally distributed at the close of each academic year.

div.div: Through commitment and collaboration, Bartow County middle school principals secure a tentative plan to provide its families with virtual Awards Day ceremonies that focus on academics, athletics, clubs, and other special awards normally distributed at the close of each academic year.

AP student will have the opportunity to take AP Exams at home, online. AP Exams will be given from May 11-May 22 and will be 45 minutes in length. This year’s tests will cover the content and skills learned through early March. Click here for more information.
The Bartow County School System is excited to announce June 25, 2020, as the official commencement date for Adairsville, Cass, and Woodland high school students, should local and state laws allow.
In preparation for the close of the 2019-2020 school year, please review the academic framework provided here by the Bartow County School System.
After a flood of sadness following Gov. Brian Kemp’s last mandated school closure, affecting the Class of 2020 and senior milestone events, comes hope for brighter days ahead.

h2.a: Ready, Set, READ! Summer Reading Resources

div.div:
Summer shouldn't mean taking a break from learning, especially reading. Studies show that most students experience a loss of reading skills over the summer months, but children who continue to read will gain skills.
Summer reading should be fun. We have several tips on how to help your child continue to read over the summer and enjoy it!
We have FREE resources available here. We have tips, ideas, and book lists here.
